reviewText:
Have thoroughly enjoyed the DVD set but wish the quality could have been better.
Can't complain when have a series this old.

I remember watching the Kingfish, Amos, and Andy when I was a small boy.  It use to come on right before the Honeymooners.  I bought another set to give to my brother for Christmas.  I highly recommend this if you cherish the nostalgia of an earlier time.

The original (currently deleted) Amos 'n' Andy Show Platinum Edition was a 70-plus show box set of 16 DVDs. Episodes were dubbed from SLP tapes of TV broadcasts. Most were overly blurry and had weak audio. Don't expect anything more from this current smaller gathering. Sadly, there is no definitive Amos & Andy collection, and may never be. It's a shame too, for these Charles Barton directed shows were darn good (some were scripted by Paul Henning of later BEVERLY HILLBILLIES /PETTICOAT JUNCTION /GREEN ACRES) fame).

The set of dvds had some episodes with little or no sound.  I exchanged it for another set and found the same problems on the same episodes.  I believe that the master from which these dvds were made was bad.  I was dissatified with the dvds, but not with the amazon experience since I had no trouble returning the dvds nor in receiving a full refund including my shipping costs to return both sets of dvds.
